thread.title: Brockport volleyball holding "Crush Cancer" benefit 10/3

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Brockport volleyball holding "Crush Cancer" benefit 10/3
text:
by Caurie Putnam The Brockport Central School District’s volleyball program will host their 4th annual “Crush Cancer” benefit at the A.D. Oliver Middle School on Saturday, October 3 from 5 p.m. to 8 p.m.
Raising awareness of cervical cancer, in honor of Fred W. Hill School teacher Lisa Byrne-Emmerson, is the focus of this year's "Crush Cancer" event.
There will be silent auctions, raffles and volleyball played by the JV and Varsity girls and boys teams with alumni. The modified teams will be assisting with the event.
Donations will also be accepted at the door.
Some of the local businesses that have donated to the raffles are: Jimmy Z's, Lowes of Brockport, Deerfield Country Club, Brockport Custom Carpet, Body by Summer, Perris pizza, Timber Ridge Golf Club, College of Brockport alumni, Amora Mexican, Bateman Orthodonics, Braces of Greece, C&S Salon, My Nail Salon, Game Players Unlimited, Pizza Hut, Java Junction, Lift Bridge Books, Main St. Pizza, Robb's Farm, Dollar General, Party City, Subway, Tim Hortons, Tastefully Simple and many more.
Donations will be accepted at the door and there will be a gift raffle and concessions available.
